description: Core functionality stories including backlog management and essential features

stories.title: Client-Specific Story Access
stories.userStory: As a logged-in client, I can only view user stories that have been explicitly shared with me by the admin or PM.
acceptanceCriteria: Client can only see stories that have been specifically shared with them
Stories not shared with the client are completely hidden from view
Admin/PM can see which clients have access to which stories
Changes to sharing permissions are reflected immediately

stories.title: Backlog Story Viewer
stories.userStory: As a client, I can see a list of user stories with expandable detail (not editable), including story points and business value.
acceptanceCriteria: Stories are displayed in a scrollable list view
Each story shows title, points, and business value in collapsed view
Stories can be expanded to show full details including user story text
Story list can be filtered by category and business value

stories.title: Save and Load Scenarios
stories.userStory: As a client, I can save scope matrix configurations and reload them later for comparison or revision.
acceptanceCriteria: User can save the current scope matrix configuration with a name and description
All saved configurations are listed and can be selected for loading
Loading a configuration correctly restores all story positions
User is prompted for confirmation before replacing the current matrix configuration

stories.title: Role-Based Permissions and Visibility
stories.userStory: As a system admin, I can manage user roles and restrict which parts of the interface different roles can see or interact with.
acceptanceCriteria: System supports at least 3 different roles (Admin, PM, Client)
Each UI element has appropriate visibility settings based on user role
Admin can assign and modify user roles
Role changes take effect immediately without requiring users to log out

stories.title: Scenario Saving Enhancement
stories.userStory: As a product manager, I want to save my scenario configurations including story positions, rankings, and adjustments so I can revisit them later.
acceptanceCriteria: Save dialog includes fields for name, description, and optional tags
Saved scenarios include all story positions, rankings, and custom adjustments
Saved scenarios can be organized into collections
Scenarios can be exported to and imported from JSON files

stories.title: Backlog Story Management
stories.userStory: As a product manager, I want to create, edit, and delete user stories directly in the backlog, so I can efficiently manage the product backlog without leaving the application.
acceptanceCriteria: PM can add new stories with all required fields plus acceptance criteria
Stories can be edited with full validation of required fields
Stories can be deleted with confirmation dialog
Changes are saved to the database in real-time
Multiple stories can be selected for batch operations
